alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton; Dorchester; Inland Berkeley; Tidal Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 6:49PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON, COLLETON, BERKELEY AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 649 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hampton Plantation State Park to near Downtown Charleston to 33 miles southeast of Folly Beach, and moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Goose Creek, Hanahan, McClellanville, Fort Sumter, Downtown Charleston, and West Ashley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
